content.description: Climb up the double cracks on a right facing corner. At the top head around the block on the right.
content.location: Located behind Group Camp 1 on the left hand side of the wall 30' down and right of Bug on a Wall. At the top you can rap off the rings on Bug.

content.description: This route starts out in a hand size crack on a East facing slab and continues up the arete past one bolt. The rock in crack is poor and the face quality is lacking. It could clean up over time.
content.protection: You will need Cams to 4" to protect the crack Its short so a couple will do. There is one bolt on the face above the crack and a new set of rap rings on top.
content.location: This route is on a dark brown slab that faces east. It is in the back left corner of the Group Camp 1 wall.

climbs.name: Book of Durian
climbs.fa: ? Doubt I was the first one

content.description:
Very obvious open book corner to the right side and almost immediately above group site 1. It looked striking from below but the fun part is pretty short. After consulting 4 different books for the area and not finding the climb I scoped out a possible descent and you can walk out on back. Decent rock with some kitty litter on the cracks but not too bad.

I'd imagine it's been done before but couldn't find any info on it at all despite the obvious line and location. If there is another name please change it/comment.

I had some durian there a couple of days before, there is some sharp rock as usual for J-tree, and the crack is like the opening of a durian, so just thought the name was good.
content.protection:
Standard rack to #3. The main crack on second part can be a bit dirty so nuts are good too. # 3 is handy near the top.

Several options for an anchor, I had a #4 and that was handy for an anchor.
content.location: Descent can be done by walking down the back or with an easy rappel off rap rings on Bug on a Wall (when you top out just got right around the corner and between the rock walls, , you can see the rings if you look right on the rock face)
